alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 3:44AM EST until February 07 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Conasauga River near Tilton affecting Whitfield, Gordon and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oostanaula River near Calhoun affecting Gordon County. Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Conasauga River Basin...including Eton, Crandall, Dalton, Keiths Mill near Dalton, Chatsworth, Tilton, Sloan Bridge near Dalton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Flint River Basin...including Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Horton, Lovejoy, Americus, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin Hwy. 16, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, East Juliette, West Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Hawkinsville, Clinchfield, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 13 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EST Sunday was 13 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 02/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
